intro: Piper guazacapanense, commonly known as Guazacánense pepper, is a species of flowering plant in the family Piperaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central America, particularly in countries like Guatemala and Honduras. The plant is characterized by its climbing habit, with opposite, ovate leaves that have a rough texture. Its small, greenish-white flowers are borne in clusters and are followed by elongated, three-lobed fruits. This species is of interest to botanists and horticulturists due to its unique morphology and potential medicinal properties.
